DataAnalyzer.Data package¶

Submodules¶

DataAnalyzer.Data.cl_data module¶

This module is responsible for creating a Data tree from a dictionary

class DataAnalyzer.Data.cl_data.FileData(__header__: bytes, __version__: str, __globals__: list, plot_data)[source]¶

FileData is the top-level class for storing the config and Data specified in the mat file in a hierarchical structure.

Note

This tree is build upon nested classes and not inheritance!

When creating mat files, the variables __header__, __version__ and __globals__ always get set. Because double underscores are Python specific syntax these variables get stored without them. plot_data is read from the mat file as a dictionary and contains the actual configuration and plotting Data.

Parameters:
  • __header__ (bytes) – Matlab specific header
  • __version__ (str) – Matlab version
  • __globals__ (list) – Matlab globals
  • plot_data (dict) – Data for creating the plots

When declaring self.plot_data, plot_data is given to the constructor of PlotData class.

class PlotData(data, plot, meta)[source]¶

PlotData only defines the __init__ method to store Data, where the members self.Data, self.Plot and self.meta are declared.

self.Data’s keys are assigned dynamically, so the variable self.Data is a dictionary itself, that can be accessed with the keywords defined previously.

Parameters:data (dict) – Data contains the actual Plot Data

The same is true for self.Plot, where different Plot types can be defined. The dict’s values are defined as objects of the Figure class which then contains a list of all figure configuration.

Parameters:plot (dict) – Plot contains the configuration of the plots

self.meta contains meta information like the time when the trace has been recorded. self.meta gets assigned to an object of the Meta dataclass.

Parameters:meta (dict) – meta contains meta information about the recorded Data
class Data(values: list, name: str, unit: str)[source]¶

Data is the class, where the actual plotting Data can be stored in.

class Figure(figure)[source]¶

Figure defines the __init__ method, as well as the FigConfig class. The figure configuration can be accessed with plot_data.Plot[…].figure[n]

The amount of figures can vary, therefore self.figure gets assigned as a list.

Parameters:figure – a dictionary with the figure config as its value
class FigConfig(subplot, subplot_rows: int = 1, subplot_cols: int = 1, constrained_layout: bool = True)[source]¶

FigConfig only defines an __init__ method. It takes the actual figure configuration. Besides the figure config, it contains the subplots and their configuration. It is possible to create custom Plot types, therefore the configuration of the subplots is outsourced to the PlotConfig package. FigConfig only imports those classes dynamically and creates objects with the according values.

Note

Custom plotting types can be added

Note

individual subplots configs are saved dynamically as Plot type objects!

__init__ defines the figure configuration:

Parameters:
  • subplot (list) – list of subplot configs
  • subplot_rows (int) – number of subplots in y-dimension
  • subplot_cols (int) – number of subplots in x-dimension
  • constrained_layout (bool) – automatic, ideal space organization
class Meta(timestamp_last_sample: float, location: str, machine: str, worker: str)[source]¶

Meta is the class, where meta information can be stored in.

DataAnalyzer.Data.data module¶

This module creates a mat file from the dictionary specified in it.

DataAnalyzer.Data.data.save_mat(name)[source]¶

This function utilizes the scipy.io.savemat() method to create mat files
